basic_overview.title: Basic Overview
basic_overview.content:
Cells = power and heat
Power = money
Money = Bigger cells and more money
Lots of money = particle accelerators
Particle accelerators = exotic particles (EP)
EP = more upgrades and new toys for more power, heat and money!
TF = Time Flux = Offline time accumulated (speeds game up when enabled)

parts.cells: Cells are your primary power generators. They produce both power and heat.
parts.reflectors: Reflectors boost the power output of adjacent cells.
parts.capacitors: Capacitors increase your reactor's maximum power capacity.
parts.particleAccelerators: Particle Accelerators generate Exotic Particles (EP) based on heat.
parts.vents: Vents actively cool your reactor by removing heat each tick.
parts.heatExchangers: Heat Exchangers evenly distribute heat between adjacent components.
parts.heatInlets: Heat Inlets push heat from adjacent components into the reactor.
parts.heatOutlets: Heat Outlets pull heat from the reactor into adjacent components.
parts.coolantCells: Coolant Cells passively absorb heat from adjacent components.
parts.reactorPlatings: Reactor Platings increase your reactor's maximum heat capacity.

controls.autoSell: Automatically sells a portion of your power.
controls.autoBuy: Automatically replaces depleted components if you have Perpetual upgrades (Cells, Capacitors, Reflectors).
controls.timeFlux: Accelerates game time, making everything happen faster.
controls.heatController: Automatically reduces heat when it gets too high.
controls.pause: Pauses all reactor operations. Use this to plan changes or prevent accidents.

upgrades.general: Upgrades provide permanent improvements to your reactor's capabilities.
upgrades.experimental: Experimental upgrades cost Exotic Particles (EP) and persist through reboots.
